Message.Title: I want to be Jeff Bezos when I grow up. John Donahoe
Message.Msg: Every night when I go home after a long days work I beat my wife and kick my dog to make myself feel better about myself. Why? Because another day has gone by that Jeff Bezos has taken his thumb and squashed me down into the worm filled mud. Why does he get to soar to the top, multiplying investors daily and accruing gains in the hundreds when I struggle to stay in the double digits? It's humiliating! I've bent sellers over to the best of my ability. What am I doing wrong? I think I'll go fire some low life employees so I can feel like a man. John Donahoe

Message.Title: ""PayPal’s potential is phenomenal.""
Message.Msg: ""PayPal’s potential is phenomenal. Consider that PayPal was responsible for 15 percent of all e-commerce transactions in 2012. Online spending is only going to increase as the years pass. Therefore, PayPal is extremely well-positioned. And this potential is global, not just domestic. eBay is looking to market PayPal globally through mobile. It’s especially going after Brazil, Russia, India, and China. It should also be noted that eBay is taking a slow and steady approach with PayPal opposed to getting ahead of itself. This is a good sign.""

Topic.Title: ""PayPal’s potential is phenomenal.""

Message.Msg: I'm sure what US based eBay merchants want is more exposure in BRIC countries!!! Nah, look at it the other way, Paypal is moving out of educated US consumer territory into third world countries Why, because there is no consumer protection. Fleecing the ignorant masses, the world is divided into classes.
